data.title: Matt McDonough in focus
data.meta_description: Richmond’s VFL coach Tim Clarke provides an exclusive insight into the 2013 performance and future prospects of a group of young Tigers, who played predominantly under his coaching guidance at Coburg this year. First-up, he takes a look at Matt McDonough . . .
data.text:
In a new off-season series on richmondfc.com.au, Richmond’s VFL coach Tim Clarke provides an exclusive insight into the 2013 performance and future prospects of a group of young Tigers, who played predominantly under his coaching guidance at Coburg this year. First-up, he takes a look at Matt McDonough . . .

Matt McDonough profile

Born: 26/1/94

Height: 180cm

Weight: 84kg

Recruited from: Flinders Park (SA),/Woodville-West Torrens (SANFL)

Draft history: Selected by Richmond at pick 42 overall in the 2012 National Draft

AFL debut: Round 21, 2013 v Carlton, MCG

AFL games: 1

AFL goals: 0

Tim Clarke says: “He came to us as a small forward, but ended up playing more midfield than forward.

“His best game, he had 13 or 14 clearances and over 30 touches, so he can really find the ball.

“His ability to use it is second to none at the Club . . . he’s got a really good leg on him.

“He kicks goals and marks the ball really well, so he’s a really exciting prospect . . . probably a Paul Chapman type of player, who’s hopefully going to have an impact at senior level next year.”
